<file>
00001| # <a name="up"/>Vozovoz API 2.5
00002| 
00003| [Main page](/en/README.md) > [Objects](index.md) > Wrapping
00004| 
00005| 
00006| > **Object code: `wrapping`**
00007| 
00008| ## Contents
00009| 
00010| * [Description](#description)
00011| * [Getting data for one or more wrappings](#get)
00012|     * [General example of the structure](#get-example)
00013|     * [Description of the structure](#get-struct)
00014|     * [Response data](#get-response)
00015|         * [Example of a response](#get-response-example)
00016|         * [Description of a response structure](#get-response-description)
00017| 
00018| 
00019| ## <a name="description"/>Wrapping
00020| 
00021| Represents an object used to obtain data of available cargo packages.
00022| 
00023| Packages are divided into two types: quantitative and volumetric. To pass a `wrapping` structure in a request,
00024| when finalizing an order or requesting a price you must specify the unique packaging code as a key,
00025| and set the value depending on the type of packaging.
00026| For quantitative packages, integer values imply the number of pieces of the specified package,
00027| and for volumetric ones — volume of cargo (m<sup>3</sup>) that needs to be packed.
00028| 
00029| >In this manual for easier understanding a word **_structures_** will be used
00030| to name any structured data (mostly that contains other structures inside,
00031| but also that contains simple data types, like string, number, boolean).
00032| We name **full** necessary data object, that used in a request to our server
00033| — ["parameters"](../params/index.md). Key to pass "parameters" into a request
00034| called "params". More about that [here](../params/post.md). And we name **_nodes_**
00035| certain structures with a defined key, that this structure is assigned to.
00036| 
00037| 
00038| ## <a name="get"/>Getting data. Action `get`
00039| 
00040| 
00041| ### <a name="get-get"/>Request data
00042| 
00043| > In this request every structure is **_optional_**, that is, it can be omitted.
00044| 
00045| #### <a name="get-example"/>General example of the structure
00046| 
00047| ```javascript
00048| // full javascript code to use in web browser developer console, see in "Quick start" section
00049| xhttp.send(JSON.stringify(
00050| {
00051|   "object": "wrapping",
00052|   "action": "get",
00053|   "params": {
00054|     "code": "hardBoxVolume", // specify a certain packaging by code
00055|     // without the parameter above this method will return the full list
00056|     "limit": 0, // 0 is for default limit
00057|     "offset": 0
00058|   }
00059| }
00060| ```
00061| 
00062| #### <a name="get-struct"/>Root structure. Passed directly into `params` node
00063| 
00064| | Structure   | Type    | Description                                                                                                                    |
00065| |-------------|---------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00066| | `code`      | string  | Specifies the package for which data should be returned. If not specified, the method returns a list of all available packages |
00067| | `limit`     | integer | Limits the number of records returned                                                                                          |
00068| | `offset`    | integer | Sets the offset for the number of records returned                                                                             |
00069| 
00070| 
00071| ### <a name="get-response"/>Response data
00072| 
00073| * [Example of a response](#get-response-example)
00074| * [Description of a response data](#get-response-description)
00075| 
00076| <a name="get-response-example"/>Example of a response:
00077| 
00078| ```javascript
00079| {
00080|   "response": [
00081|     {
00082|       "code": "hardPackageVolume", // unique code of the wrapping
00083|       "name": "Жёсткая упаковка", // name of the wrapping
00084|       "type": "volume", // type of the wrapping is volumetric
00085|       // it means, that passing its values in other requests, these values must be frational positive numbers 
00086|       // that specify the volume of cargo that requires packaging
00087|       "description": "Description for the client in Russian"
00088|     },
00089|     {
00090|       "code": "box3",
00091|       "name": "Коробка 40×40×20 см",
00092|       "type": "numeric", // type of the wrapping is quantitative
00093|       // it means, that passing its values in other requests, these values must be positive integers, 
00094|       // that specify the quantity of these packages
00095|       "description": "Описание для клиента"
00096|     }
00097|     // the number of results depends on their number for this request and the `limit` node
00098|   ]
00099| }
00100| ```
00101| 
00102| <a name="get-response-description"/>Description of a response data:
00103| 
00104| | Name          | Type   | Description                                                                   |
00105| |---------------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
00106| | `code`        | string | Unique code of the wrapping                                                   |
00107| | `description` | string | Description of the wrapping                                                   |
00108| | `name`        | string | Name (definition) of the wrapping                                             |
00109| | `type`        | string | Type of the wrapping. Can be `numeric` (quantitative) и `volume` (volumetric) |
00110| 
00111| ***
00112| [▲ Up](#up)
</file>
